title: Stock Futures Rise Ahead of Earnings, Housing Data; Goldman Sachs, Bank of America and IBM are among the companies scheduled to report results
text:
Europe stocks advanced Monday for a two-session run of gains. The Stoxx Europe 600 added 0.7% in morning trade. Financials and materials sectors led gains while the healthcare sector lost ground.

Rio Tinto Group climbed 2.7% for a two-day winning streak and Anglo American jumped 3.2%.

The U.K.'s FTSE 100 rose 0.9%. Other stock indexes in Europe also mostly climbed as France's CAC 40 added 0.7%, the U.K.'s FTSE 250 climbed 0.7% and Germany's DAX rose 0.7%.

The Swiss franc, the euro and the British pound gained 0.1%, 0.5% and 0.4% respectively against the U.S. dollar.

In commodities, Brent crude strengthened 2.6% to $103.84 a barrel. Gold was also up 0.6% to $1,714.10 a troy ounce.

The yield on German 10-year bunds was up to 1.194% and 10-year U.K. government debt known as gilts yields gained to 2.124%. 10-year U.S. Treasury yields strengthened to 2.955% from 2.929% on Friday. Yields and prices move in opposite directions.

In Asia, indexes climbed as Hong Kong's Hang Seng gained 2.4% and China's benchmark Shanghai Composite rose 1.6%.
